t: Jeremiah 49
Concerning*p the Ammonites, thus saith the Lord;*s Hath Israel no sons? hath he no heir? why then doth their king inherit Gad, and his people dwell in his cities?

Therefore,*p behold, the days come, saith the Lord,*s that I will cause an alarm of war to be heard in Rabbah of the Ammonites; and it shall be a desolate heap, and her daughters shall be burned with fire: then shall Israel be heir unto them that were his heirs, saith the Lord.*s

Howl,*p O Heshbon, for Ai is spoiled: cry, ye daughters of Rabbah, gird you with sackcloth; lament, and run to and fro by the hedges; for their king shall go into captivity, and his priests and his princes together.
Wherefore*p gloriest thou in the valleys, thy flowing valley, O backsliding daughter? that trusted in her treasures, saying, Who shall come unto me?

Behold,*p I will bring a fear upon thee, saith the Lord God*s of hosts, from all those that be about thee; and ye shall be driven out every man right forth; and none shall gather up him that wandereth.
And*p afterward I will bring again the captivity of the children of Ammon, saith the Lord.*s
Concerning*p Edom, thus saith the Lord*s of hosts; Is wisdom no more in Teman? is counsel perished from the prudent? is their wisdom vanished?
Flee*p ye, turn back, dwell deep, O inhabitants of Dedan; for I will bring the calamity of Esau upon him, the time that I will visit him.
If*p grapegatherers come to thee, would they not leave some gleaning grapes? if thieves by night, they will destroy till they have enough.
But*p I have made Esau bare, I have uncovered his secret places, and he shall not be able to hide himself: his seed is spoiled, and his brethren, and his neighbours, and he is not.
Leave*p thy fatherless children, I will preserve them alive; and let thy widows trust in me.

For*p thus saith the Lord;*s Behold, they whose judgment was not to drink of the cup have assuredly drunken; and art thou he that shall altogether go unpunished? thou shalt not go unpunished, but thou shalt surely drink of it.
For*p I have sworn by myself, saith the Lord,*s that Bozrah shall become a desolation, a reproach, a waste, and a curse; and all the cities thereof shall be perpetual wastes.
I*p have heard a rumour from the Lord,*s and an ambassador is sent unto the heathen, saying, Gather ye together, and come against her, and rise up to the battle.
For,*p lo, I will make thee small among the heathen, and despised among men.

Thy*p terribleness hath deceived thee, and the pride of thine heart, O thou that dwellest in the clefts of the rock, that holdest the height of the hill: though thou shouldest make thy nest as high as the eagle, I will bring thee down from thence, saith the Lord.*s
Also*p Edom shall be a desolation: every one that goeth by it shall be astonished, and shall hiss at all the plagues thereof.
As*p in the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbour cities thereof, saith the Lord,*s no man shall abide there, neither shall a son of man dwell in it.

Behold,*p he shall come up like a lion from the swelling of Jordan against the habitation of the strong: but I will suddenly make him run away from her: and who is a chosen man, that I may appoint over her? for who is like me? and who will appoint me the time? and who is that shepherd that will stand before me?

Therefore*p hear the counsel of the Lord,*s that he hath taken against Edom; and his purposes, that he hath purposed against the inhabitants of Teman: Surely the least of the flock shall draw them out: surely he shall make their habitations desolate with them.
The*p earth is moved at the noise of their fall, at the cry the noise thereof was heard in the Red sea.
Behold,*p he shall come up and fly as the eagle, and spread his wings over Bozrah: and at that day shall the heart of the mighty men of Edom be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.
Concerning*p Damascus. Hamath is confounded, and Arpad: for they have heard evil tidings: they are fainthearted; there is sorrow on the sea; it cannot be quiet.
Damascus*p is waxed feeble, and turneth herself to flee, and fear hath seized on her: anguish and sorrows have taken her, as a woman in travail.
How*p is the city of praise not left, the city of my joy!
Therefore*p her young men shall fall in her streets, and all the men of war shall be cut off in that day, saith the Lord*s of hosts.
And*p I will kindle a fire in the wall of Damascus, and it shall consume the palaces of Benâ€“hadad.
Concerning*p Kedar, and concerning the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon shall smite, thus saith the Lord;*s Arise ye, go up to Kedar, and spoil the men of the east.
Their*p tents and their flocks shall they take away: they shall take to themselves their curtains, and all their vessels, and their camels; and they shall cry unto them, Fear is on every side.
Flee,*p get you far off, dwell deep, O ye inhabitants of Hazor, saith the Lord;*s for Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon hath taken counsel against you, and hath conceived a purpose against you.
Arise,*p get you up unto the wealthy nation, that dwelleth without care, saith the Lord,*s which have neither gates nor bars, which dwell alone.

And*p their camels shall be a booty, and the multitude of their cattle a spoil: and I will scatter into all winds them that are in the utmost corners; and I will bring their calamity from all sides thereof, saith the Lord.*s
And*p Hazor shall be a dwelling for dragons, and a desolation for ever: there shall no man abide there, nor any son of man dwell in it.
The*p word of the Lord*s that came to Jeremiah the prophet against Elam in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, saying,
Thus*p saith the Lord*s of hosts; Behold, I will break the bow of Elam, the chief of their might.
And*p upon Elam will I bring the four winds from the four quarters of heaven, and will scatter them toward all those winds; and there shall be no nation whither the outcasts of Elam shall not come.

For*p I will cause Elam to be dismayed before their enemies, and before them that seek their life: and I will bring evil upon them, even my fierce anger, saith the Lord;*s and I will send the sword after them, till I have consumed them:
And*p I will set my throne in Elam, and will destroy from thence the king and the princes, saith the Lord.*s
But*p it shall come to pass in the latter days, that I will bring again the captivity of Elam, saith the Lord.*s
